name: Concert 5 - Saturday 26th April 2014
description:
We are delighted to welcome a host of special guests for this one-off spectacular concert. Andy Scott has a growing reputation as a composer across the world and the band will be performing a whole host of wonderful new arrangements for concert band. Andy will be performing himself, alongside tuba virtuoso Les Neish who will recite Andy's Salt of the Earth concerto.

We warmly welcome the Kent Youth Jazz Orchestra led by Graham Mann who will perform a set at the beginning of the second half, before we conclude the evening with a performance of George Gershwin's famous Rhapsody in Blue with young pianist Philip Leslie. All of this taking place in the wonderful Pamoja Hall venue in Sevenoaks. It's a concert not to be missed.

26th April 2014 at 19:30pm
Pamoja Hall, 
Sevenoaks School, 
Sevenoaks, 
Kent 
TN13 1HU

Tickets are £10 adults, £8 concession, children under 12 FREE.

Tickets available for collection on the door only. Please note there is a small administration fee which will show as 'postage' on your order.

name: Concert 4 - Saturday 15th February 2014
description:
Wagner's music is undeniably spectacular and ground-breaking, and none more so than his whirl wind 'Flying Dutchman Overture'. 

The band will then be joined by Scottish Opera trumpeter Huw Morgan and saxophonist Tim Watson in performances for solo instruments by two British composers Richard Rodney Bennett and Peter Meechan. Bennett (of Kent origins) composed his 'Trumpet Concerto' in 1993 and is dedicated to Maestro Tim Reynish. It contains three movements of vast contrast, including a beautiful second movement 'Elegy for Miles Davis' where the trumpet soars in this deeply felt ballad.

'Fenix Blue' written by Peter Meechan makes reference to the large blues influence in the piece, but the Fenix referred to in the title is a dedication to the Phoenix 2 capsule that rescued the 33 Chilean minors who were trapped underground for 69 days in 2010, the last of whom was brought to the surface in the capsule as Meechan completed the piece. 

We conclude with Ferrer Ferran's telling of the Pinocchio story. This symphonic suite takes us through the trials and tribulations of the famous puppet and all his wild adventures. With large symphonic scoring, this epic work is a fitting end to the concert.

15th February at 19:30pm 
All Saints Church, Mill Street, Maidstone, ME15 6YE.

Tickets are £10 adults, £8 concession, children under 12 FREE.

Tickets available for collection on the door only. Please note there is a small administration fee which will show as 'postage' on your order.

name: Workshops
description:
Maidstone Wind Symphony is delighted to announce a series of workshops for the 2013/2014 season.

ME15 6YE

All Saints Church
Mill Street

ME15 6YE

Brass Workshop with Glenn Van Looy (Euphonium and Tuba)

ME15 6YE

Places are limited. 

Places are £10 per person & you just need to provide your name at the door.  To book your place please choose the relevant workshop from the drop-down menu.  Please note there is a small administration fee which will show as 'postage' on your order.

All of the workshop leaders will be performing with Maidstone Wind Symphony in an evening concert on the same day as the workshop.

If you would like further information on the workshops please email us at Workshops@MaidstoneWindSymphony.org or call 01732 366 500. For more information on our workshop leaders, please visit the ‘links’ page on our website and click on their name.

name: 2013/2014 Concert Season Ticket
description:
Season ticket for 2013/2014 Maidstone Wind Symphony concerts.

Being a season ticket holder will automatically add you to our mailing list and give you free programmes at all our concerts.

name: Slide Projections
description:
Maidstone Wind Symphony is delighted to launch its first professional recording, Slide Projections, in association with Brett Baker, acclaimed trombonist of the world-famous Black Dyke Band.

Slide Projections features wonderful new music for symphonic band and trombone including the 'T-Bone Concerto' by Johan de Meij, Philip Sparke's 'Trombone Concerto' and the world premiere recording of Rob Wiffin's brand new 'Concerto for Trombone'. Wiffin's concerto was written specifically for Baker, who is an ambassador for new trombone compositions and has been involved in the commissioning of over 100 works.
